If something has majesty, it causes admiration and respect for its beauty: This music has majesty, power, and passion. The photograph captures the sunset in all its majesty.

the title used to speak to or about a king or queen: I was invited to tea with Her Majesty the Queen. their Majesties, the King and Queen of Spain [ as form of address ] The performance begins at eight o'clock, (Your) Majesty.

at Her/His Majesty's pleasure UK
used to describe a prison sentence (= time in prison) that does not have a fixed length: She was sentenced to be detained at Her Majesty's pleasure.
informal used to mean "in prison": He has had several spells at Her Majesty's pleasure.
